newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan dlr ends higher on central bank resolve.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan dlr ends higher on central bank resolve.

text.p: The Taiwan dollar closed higher against its U.S. counterpart on Friday as the central bank's recent rate-stabilising resolve eased speculative pressure against the local currency, dealers said.
The local unit, bobbing in a narrow range throughout the session, closed at T$27.926 against Thursday's T$27.939 finish.
Turnover through dealers was relatively active at US$322 million.

Central bank vice governor Liang Cheng-chin said late on Thursday that the bank would marshal "appropriate measures" if foreign exchange speculators resumed recent efforts to pressure the local currency lower.
Liang added the kind of currency crisis that has hit Thailand and the Philippines "could never happen" in Taiwan.

The Taiwan dollar, which has faced downward pressure in July due to some speculative buying of non-delivery forwards and the general strength of the U.S. dollar against the yen, averted a fall on Thursday following what dealers described as clear central bank intervention.
"The central bank's recent efforts apparently paid off, as the market seemed unwilling to chase after a higher U.S. dollar," said one dealer at a foreign bank.
"The speculators tested the central bank's attitude, and the central bank made it clear," he added.
Dealers said they expected the Taiwan dollar to resume a downtrend for the near term -- but only a mild descend deemed acceptable by the central bank.
A T$27.92-95 range was seen for Saturday.
